DOCNAME: CASE OF AHMET SADIK v. GREECE
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection allowed (non-exhaustion of domestic remedies)
TEXT: CARDINAL . Mr PERSON , a NORP national of the NORP faith , was born in DATE and lived in PERSON ( Western Thrace ) . He was a doctor , publisher of the DATE newspaper ORG " ) and a member of ORG . He died on DATE in a road accident near PERSON .

CARDINAL . ORG The applicant was the sole candidate of the political party Güven - representing part of the NORP population of LOC - to win a seat in the parliamentary election of DATE . As no government emerged from that election , a fresh poll was planned for DATE in which the applicant intended to stand as a candidate .
CARDINAL . ORG On various dates between DATE and CARDINAL DATE Mr PERSON published in the newspaper Güven and circulated in the region a number of communiqués , including the following :
" TO THE ORG ELECTORATE OF THE DEPARTMENT OF RODOPI

In response to the repeated requests of the Turco - Muslim electorate of the department of GPE , we , journalist GPE ismail ( of GPE ) , PERSON and theologian PERSON , have decided to stand in the general election of DATE as members of the independent NORP list . The NORP community of LOC , especially since DATE , has been through some unhappy experiences at the hands of political parties . At the elections of DATE , in an upsurge of unity , it placed its trust in the independent NORP list . It asserted its identity and took its destiny into its own hands by electing a member of that list to represent it in ORG . For the elections of DATE it is equally determined to send to ORG a representative who enjoys its trust .
After the historic victory won on DATE the NORP electors of the department of GPE never again wish to return to the old parties and live once more DATE when they were despondent and crushed .

Moreover , we suffer when we observe the manoeuvres of the other parties , who , in order to win the precious ORG vote in LOC , are playing on the fears of the people in our towns and villages . Some who seem to be of our own kind still dare , under the pretext of defending the rights of the NORP community in LOC , to call for the votes of our honest , fair - minded fellow citizens . It is painful to see that these adventurers can still walk abroad among us . The only thing the members of the NORP - Muslim community of LOC want is to live in dignity in the country where they were born and have grown up . No force will halt their just and legitimate struggle .

We place all our trust in God first of all , but also in the honest and conscientious ORG electorate , who believe in our cause . The NORP electorate of the department of GPE , whose motto is ' CARDINAL for all and all for one ' will express their trust in GPE on DATE and overcome all their adversaries with honour and respect . ... "

The applicant was convicted of an offence on the basis of the above article , a NORP translation of which was read out at his trial in ORG and in ORG ( see paragraphs CARDINAL , DATE and CARDINAL below ) .
In another communiqué he wrote :
" YOUNG PEOPLE ! SHOULDER YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
ON DATE ORG HAVE BEEN SUFFERING SINCE THE DAY OF THEIR BIRTH IN WESTERN THRACE WILL AT DATE BE ABLE TO SAY ' NO ' TO THE POLITICAL PARTIES WHO ARE MAKING THEM LIVE AN INHUMAN LIFE
YOUNG PEOPLE ! ORG IS STRENGTH ! STICK TOGETHER ! YOUR VOTE IS AS PRECIOUS AS YOUR HONOUR , BE CAREFUL HOW YOU CAST IT !
THE YOUNG NORP OF WESTERN THRACE , WHOSE SLOGAN IS ' WE WANT RIGHTS , NOT CHARITY ' ARE GOING TO ENFORCE RESPECT FOR THEIR RIGHTS
ORG THRACE
In this community of CARDINAL ORG of LOC the highest duty , one which will fill you with honour and pride , falls to you . The date of the fresh general election , DATE , is approaching .
For DATE you have been affected most by the pressure , discrimination and injustice inflicted on the NORP community of LOC by the leaders who have followed each other at the head of this country .
You have breathed in the fumes of injustice and discrimination since birth .
Your innocent childhood passed by in injustice . You were not able to shout out to the world ' I am a NORP child ' .

In our world , where education and training are so highly developed , your schooling was cut short . You did not even have a schoolbook when ethnic - NORP children were getting a modern education and taking advantage of the cultural and technological developments of their time .

You have the necessary intelligence to become a doctor , a lawyer or an engineer ... but this country which you call ' my homeland ' has shut the door of study in your face . You have grown up and become an adult in the midst of these injustices by the law of nature . Because no one could prevent you growing up . Perhaps you are also now married and a father , but you have no home for your dear wife and the children you love . You have just completed your military service but , in this country that you call ' my homeland ' , the right to buy or build a house is denied you .

As your access to higher education was barred , you learned a trade , although this meant putting up with the constant annoying remarks of your ' NORP boss ' [ Çorbaci ] down through DATE . You became a repairer of engines , exhaust pipes or tyres ... , but you still have to fill the pockets of your NORP boss , because you do not have the right to open your own workshop .

When you were born you received your name during the call to prayer ; your name appears in the district council 's register as PERSON , PERSON ... But in your place of work your boss insists on calling you ' PERSON , PERSON , PERSON ... '
With the enthusiasm of youth you leap on a tractor and work in the fields DATE and TIME . You would like to drive past in front of your friends on this tractor , but you ca n't .

Because you are not even thought worthy of permission to use the tractor . You are almost obliged to work your own land by stealth . After working DATE and saving up a bit of money you would like to go for a trip or to travel abroad . But you 're uneasy about going away . You are tormented by doubts . You wonder if you 'll lose your nationality when you return or have to surrender your passport when you leave .
YOUNG PEOPLE OF WESTERN THRACE !
You young people who came into the world in the midst of all this injustice and for whom a humiliating existence has been mapped out , your DATE has come !
In the elections of DATE , teach all those who would lock you into this injustice an unforgettable lesson .
NOBODY DOUBTS THAT YOU WILL GIVE YOUR FULL SUPPORT TO THE INDEPENDENT LIST and in so doing prove that you would rather die than abandon your national and religious roots !
Here and now you must set up ORG in your district or village and make sure that your parents and grandparents are not deceived !

On DATE of the elections , up till the time when all the votes have been counted , make sure that all the votes are not wasted by remaining either next to the ballot boxes or outside the polling station . Do not forget for a single second that your vote is as precious as your honour !
THE NORP COMMUNITY OF WESTERN THRACE TRUSTS YOU AND IS PROUD OF YOU .
LONG LIVE THE NORP AND NORP YOUTH OF WESTERN THRACE ! "

CARDINAL . ORG The applicant was then accused of contravening ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . On DATE the public prosecutor attached to ORG summoned him to appear in that court on DATE to stand trial on the following charges :
" [ In DATE , in the town of PERSON ,

( CARDINAL ) by false information and defamatory declarations about certain candidates , [ Mr PERSON ] deceived the electors in order to induce them to change the way they intended to vote ; in particular , he wrote and circulated in the town of PERSON and other places in the department of GPE a declaration in the NORP language ... in which he asserted that the NORP electors of the department of GPE were living every day - that is in the period preceding the general election of CARDINAL DATE - in an anarchic climate ( of terror ) fostered by the candidates of the other political parties ... who were going round the different villages of the department of GPE trying to win the votes of the NORP electors ...

( CARDINAL ) at the same time and in the same place he contravened LAW ... ; in particular he wrote and circulated the above - mentioned declaration in which there were frequent repetitions of the words ' PERSON ' , ' NORP ' , ' NORP minority of LOC and ' NORP community ' , used to designate the NORP minority in LOC ; by describing the NORP minority as ' NORP ' and by calling the NORP ' NORP ' rather than ' NORP ' , he provoked and incited the citizens to sow discord among themselves ( particularly on the NORP side ) and between them and the other citizens of PERSON , and thus disturbed the public peace ...
Consequently , he has contravened Articles ... CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW . "
A second summons , of DATE , directed the applicant to appear before the same court on DATE to answer the following charge :

" On DATE in the town of PERSON and in other places in the department of GPE he contravened LAW ... In particular , he published in the newspaper Güven of CARDINAL DATE a declaration signed by him ( the accused ) in which he falsely alleged the existence of discrimination against , and oppression of , ORG by the NORP administrative authorities , and of injustices committed to their detriment . Lastly , by describing the NORP minority of LOC as the ' NORP minority ' rather than the ' NORP minority of NORP faith ' , he provoked and incited the citizens , mainly on the NORP side , to reciprocal discord and thus disturbed the public peace of the citizens of LOC .
Consequently , he has contravened Articles ... and CARDINAL of LAW . "

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE Mr PERSON and his co - defendant appeared in ORG . While the witnesses were being questioned their lawyers challenged one of the court 's judges on account of the animosity he had shown towards the accused and the way he was asking the questions . After deliberating , the court dismissed the challenge , holding that the questions asked by the judge concerned did not go beyond the scope of the bill of indictment and were intended as an objective means of revealing the truth in the case under consideration . The defence lawyers then withdrew from the case and their clients stated that they did not want any other lawyer to be appointed . They conducted their own defence and denied committing the offence charged . In particular , the applicant said that his intention in the articles in issue had only been to condemn the oppression of the NORP minority by the ORG and to draw attention to the problems which members of that minority encountered in their dealings with the administrative authorities . He pointed out that the term " NORP " had been used for a long time not only in the press but also by the administrative and judicial authorities . Lastly , he asserted that the presence of a crowd which had gathered outside the court was not due to the articles in issue but to the fact that the trial was being held and the fact that the NORP ' ethnic identity was still being denied .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the court acquitted the applicant and his codefendant of electoral deception , but found them guilty of disturbing the citizens ' peace .

The court found that the accused , as the candidates of an independent party in the elections of CARDINAL DATE , had jointly written in the NORP language a declaration which they had circulated in the town of PERSON and other places in GPE and in which the terms " NORP " , " NORP " , " ORG minority of LOC " and " NORP community " repeatedly appeared . By describing NORP of PERSON and the department of GPE as NORP rather than NORP , they had intended , by appealing to the feelings , minds and will of the NORP citizens of the NORP minority , to instil and implant in their hearts the seeds of discord , hatred and hostility towards NORP of PERSON and the department of GPE , to provoke and incite the citizens of the CARDINAL communities to commit acts of violence and to sow discord between themselves and thus disturb , as they had moreover succeeded in doing , the public peace and the peaceful and harmonious coexistence that had obtained for DATE between the citizens of the CARDINAL NORP communities ( the NORP and the NORP ) .

The court sentenced Mr PERSON effect as it was probable that he would evade justice by absconding to GPE . Enforcement of the sentence until such time as the appeal court had given judgment would not cause either the applicant or his family excessive and irreparable prejudice .
CARDINAL . ORG The applicant remained in detention from DATE to CARDINAL DATE . His candidacy in the elections of DATE was annulled for technical reasons .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE violence broke out in PERSON , in the course of which many shops were damaged . A NORP killed a NORP in a hospital in the town .

CARDINAL . ORG For the NORP minority of LOC the date was significant as the anniversary of events which had taken place DATE , in DATE . In DATE ORG had forbidden the minority 's youth and primary school teacher associations to describe themselves as " NORP " . ORG judgment brought to a close a series of actions brought in DATE by the prefects of GPE and Xanthi in order to obtain the dissolution of ORG , the " NORP Primary Teachers ' Union of Western Thrace " and ORG " . Accordingly , in DATE , the NORP minority of LOC decided to organise a demonstration in front of the prefecture to express their disapproval of the above judgment . Although the demonstration had been banned by the police , it did in the end take place , but matters got out of hand and violent clashes took place in the town of PERSON .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the applicant appealed against the judgment of ORG . The case was referred to ORG for reasons having to do with the maintenance of order and public safety ( Articles CARDINAL ( c ) and CARDINAL para . CARDINAL ( c ) of LAW ) .
On DATE ORG upheld ORG judgment , giving the following reasons :

" The following facts have been established by the evidence of the witnesses for the prosecution and the defence examined under oath during the trial before this ORG and by the documents read out and the arguments put forward by the accused in his defence . As candidates on an independent list in the general election of CARDINAL DATE in PERSON , the accused wrote , CARDINAL DATE , a pamphlet printed in GPE which they distributed in the town of PERSON and other places in the department of GPE and in which the terms ' NORP ' , ' NORP ' , ' NORP minority of LOC and ' NORP community ' repeatedly appeared . In this manner the accused deliberately set out to describe as ' NORP " the NORP citizens of NORP faith , although they knew that under LAW only a NORP minority , not a NORP minority , has been recognised in the region of LOC . Nevertheless , by the above - mentioned act , which was an appeal to the feelings , minds and will of the NORP citizens of the NORP minority , the accused deliberately sought to instil and implant in their hearts the seeds of discord , hatred and hostility towards NORP who lived in the same region . In this manner they succeeded in provoking and inciting the citizens to mutual discord , a further consequence of which was disturbance of the public peace . All the foregoing has been corroborated by the prosecution witnesses PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON , who , living in PERSON , had direct knowledge of these facts . They stated that , because of the distribution of the pamphlet in question , the public peace among the citizens of the town of PERSON was seriously disturbed , so that in a short space of time acts of violence were committed between NORP and NORP . The accused 's assertion that what they sought to achieve through the pamphlet in question was only to win the support of the electors of the NORP population is not convincing because , if that had been the case , they could have achieved their aim by any other suitable method without referring to NORP in the pamphlet in question as ' NORP ' , even though they knew that a NORP minority is not recognised in LOC and that if they attempted to raise such an issue in such a sensitive region , the peace between NORP and NORP would certainly be disturbed , which was indeed what actually happened . Consequently , the accused are declared guilty of the above - mentioned offence , as described analytically in the operative provisions of this judgment . Nevertheless , the ORG will take into consideration the extenuating circumstance that before committing the offence the accused had always led blameless private , family , professional and social lives . "
Lastly , ORG reduced Mr PERSON prison sentence to DATE and commuted it to a fine of MONEY ( GRD ) per day .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE , after his release , the applicant was re - elected to ORG . ORG

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the applicant appealed on points of law . He maintained that the charges against him were vague and that the courts below should have dismissed the prosecution case . He also alleged that ORG had not given sufficient reasons for its decision , as NORP legislation required . In particular , he argued that ORG had not made it clear why the use of the noun " NORP " or the adjective " NORP " was per se likely to create a climate of hatred or disturb public order . Lastly , he complained that the judgment gave no specific example of events which had actually occurred towards the end of DATE and which could be said to have disturbed public peace .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal on the following grounds :

" ... LAW , which was adopted for the protection of public order and to enable a ORG based on the rule of law to deal with the kind of tension which the democratic legal order ... can not tolerate , establishes , as do Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL , the serious offence of ' disturbing the citizens ' peace ' . The objective element of this offence - according to the LAW mentioned - consists in provoking or inciting the citizens , publicly and in any manner whatsoever ( whether orally or in writing ) , to commit acts of violence or to sow discord among themselves , or aversion and hate , thus disturbing the public peace , that is to say society 's confidence in peaceful order .

The subjective element of the offence is the offender 's mens rea , which means that he must have acted knowingly and with the intent to provoke or incite the citizens to commit acts of violence or to sow discord among themselves , thus disturbing the public peace .

In the instant case ... ORG ... found ... that the appellants , who were independent candidates in PERSON in the general election of CARDINAL DATE , had jointly written towards DATE a declaration in the NORP language , which they circulated in the town of PERSON and other places in the department of GPE and in which the terms ' PERSON ' , ' NORP ' , ' ORG minority of LOC and ' NORP community ' repeatedly appeared . In this manner the appellants had deliberately attempted to describe as ' NORP ' NORP of NORP Rodopi , although they knew that LAW recognised only the existence in that region of a NORP ( religious ) minority , not a NORP minority . Nevertheless , the appellants , in appealing to the feelings , minds and will of the NORP citizens of the NORP minority , had deliberately set out to instil and implant in their hearts the seeds of discord , hate and hostility towards NORP who live in the same region . They had thus succeeded in provoking and sowing discord among the citizens , which disturbed the peace of the citizens of PERSON to such an extent that , in a short space of time , acts of violence were committed between NORP and NORP in that town . Moreover , they knew that there was no NORP minority in LOC and that their conduct would disturb the public peace between NORP and NORP .

By its reasoning ORG can be seen to have set out in the impugned judgment the specific , detailed grounds required by Article CARDINAL para . CARDINAL of the LAW and LAW , since it gave a full and clear account therein , without contradicting itself , of the facts of the case as established at the trial , which constitute the objective and subjective elements of the above - mentioned offence ...

More particularly , there is no contradiction between the reasons and the operative provisions ... , since provoking and sowing discord , thus disturbing the public peace , are sufficient to make out the objective element of the offence for which they were sentenced . Mentioning in the reasons that acts of violence had been committed , while not necessary to support the operative provisions , was not however in contradiction with those provisions , regard being had to the fact that discord is the psychological condition for an act of violence , which is the higher level of discord ...

Lastly , the appellants ' mens rea is inherent in the commission of the acts that constitute the offence , which show that they acted deliberately , knowing that they were disturbing the public peace ... "
CARDINAL . ORG The following provisions of LAW are relevant :
" Every person may express and propagate his thoughts orally , in writing and through the press in compliance with the laws of the ORG . "

" The generally acknowledged rules of international law , as well as international Conventions as of the time they are sanctioned by law and become operative according to the terms therein , shall be an integral part of domestic NORP law and shall prevail over any contrary provision of the law . The rules of international law and of international Conventions shall be applicable to aliens only under the condition of reciprocity . "
CARDINAL . ORG The relevant provisions of LAW are worded as follows :

It shall be an offence , punishable by DATE imprisonment and a fine , to deceive an elector through false information or defamatory declarations about an electoral candidate , or by any other means , either in order to prevent him from exercing his right to vote or in order to influence his voting intentions ... "

CARDINAL . It shall be an offence , punishable by DATE imprisonment , to participate in a gathering of persons ... committing acts of violence against people or property or forcibly entering houses belonging to others , dwellings or other buildings .
CARDINAL . Incitement to commit the offence or the commission of acts of violence shall be punished by not DATE imprisonment .
CARDINAL . These penalties shall be imposed if the conduct concerned is not punished more severely pursuant to another provision . " " Disturbing the citizens ' peace
It shall be an offence , punishable by DATE imprisonment , to provoke anxiety or terror among the citizens by threatening the commission of criminal offences .

It shall be an offence , punishable by not DATE imprisonment and a fine , to spread by any means false information or rumours calculated to provoke anxiety or fear among the citizens or to undermine confidence in the ORG ... or to perturb the country 's international relations . If the offence is repeated by way of the press , the offender shall be punished by not DATE imprisonment and a fine of not less than two hundred thousand drachmas .

It shall be an offence , punishable by DATE imprisonment , save where another provision lays down a harsher penalty , to provoke or incite the citizens , publicly and in any manner whatsoever , to commit acts of violence or sow discord among themselves , thus disturbing the public peace . "
